name: kubectl-claude
description: AI-powered multi-cluster Kubernetes management. Discover clusters, check health, analyze RBAC, get pods/deployments/services, and troubleshoot issues across all your Kubernetes clusters.

kubectl-claude.description: Multi-cluster Kubernetes MCP server with 22 tools for cluster management, diagnostics, and RBAC analysis

k8s-health.description: Check health of all Kubernetes clusters
k8s-health.prompt: Use the kubectl-claude MCP tools to check the health of all available Kubernetes clusters. List the clusters first, then check the health status of each one. Summarize any issues found.

k8s-issues.prompt: Use the kubectl-claude MCP tools to find all issues across Kubernetes clusters. Check for: pod issues (CrashLoopBackOff, ImagePullBackOff, OOMKilled, pending), deployment issues (stuck rollouts, unavailable replicas), and warning events. Provide a summary of all problems found with recommended actions.

k8s-analyze.prompt: Use the kubectl-claude MCP tools to perform a comprehensive analysis of a Kubernetes namespace. Ask the user which namespace to analyze if not specified. Use the analyze_namespace tool and provide insights on workloads, resource usage, and potential issues.

k8s-security.description: Check for security issues in Kubernetes
k8s-security.prompt: Use the kubectl-claude MCP tools to check for security issues across all namespaces. Look for: privileged containers, containers running as root, host network/PID/IPC usage, and missing resource limits. Provide a security report with severity levels and remediation recommendations.

k8s-rbac.description: Analyze RBAC permissions for a subject
k8s-rbac.prompt: Use the kubectl-claude MCP tools to analyze RBAC permissions. Ask the user for the subject (user, group, or service account) to analyze. Use analyze_subject_permissions to show all roles, bindings, and effective permissions. Highlight any overly permissive access.
